title: Postman commits small act of kindness and becomes a ‘laundry hero’
description: A postman has been hailed a hero for performing an extraordinary act perhaps only fully appreciated by people who dry their bed sheets outside in the sun.
content:
A postman has been hailed a hero for performing an extraordinary act perhaps only fully appreciated by people who dry their bed sheets outside in the sun.

Gurpreet Singh was caught on a homeowner’s security camera making a delivery to a suburban address in Logan, south of Brisbane, Australia last Thursday.

Instead of throwing the package towards the door, as some less professional delivery drivers might be tempted to do, Singh is seen taking the resident’s sheets off the clothesline and putting them under cover.

Homeowner Verrity Wandel was so astonished she posted the video to social media this week with the words: “This is 1 in a million. I thought I was coming home to find my wash soaking wet but NO.”

On social media, where complaints about dodgy deliveries are a more common occurrence, Singh’s thoughtful act went viral. The story was picked up by media in India, where one outlet dubbed Singh a “laundry hero.”

As their online fame spread, Singh and Wandel appeared on breakfast television in Australia, where Wandel walked viewers through the events of the day.

“I just had visions of my washing being wrapped round and round the line, or embedded in the garden, and I drove in and there was no washing on the line. And I thought, that’s odd,” she told CNN affiliate 9 News.

Asked why he did it, Singh, who seemed genuinely bewildered by the attention, said he wondered “whether I can do it or not” then did it anyway. It took “one minute,” he said.

As a member of Brisbane’s Sikh community, Singh’s a familiar face at the local temple and he’s known to perform acts of service in line with his Sikh faith, one community member told CNN.

“When I saw this act, I knew that he wasn’t doing it for any publicity or anything, that’s just who he is,” said Tejinder Singh.

Wandel denied suggestions made by one radio host that she was part of an elaborate marketing ploy on behalf of government-owned Australia Post.

Run as a commercial operation, Australia Post has struggled with losses in recent years, amid a decline in letter-sending and competition from delivery companies.

Of Singh, Australia Post said it’d been inundated by requests for information about the delivery driver, who’d worked as a contractor for four years. “He tries to help customers out where he can,” a spokesperson said.

While Wandel’s original post attracted thousands of comments in praise of Singh, a series of abusive comments prompted her to post a follow-up video.

“We should be a kinder world,” she said in the video.

“If you have the opportunity to do a totally selfless act, do it, don’t think about it. Say hello to somebody. Smile at somebody. It makes a difference.”
summary: Gurpreet Singh, a delivery driver from Brisbane, Australia, has been hailed a hero for his unusual act of kindness, which was caught on a homeowner's security camera. Instead of throwing the package towards the door, Singh took the sheets off the clothesline and put them under cover. The video was posted on social media by Verrity Wandel, who described it as "1 in a million". The story was also covered in India, where one outlet called Singh a "laundry hero". As their fame spread, Singh and Wandel appeared on breakfast television in Australia.
shortSummary: A postman in Australia, Gurpreet Singh, performed a rare act of kindness by covering up a resident’s laundry sheets under cover, gaining international acclaim.

From delivery man to laundry hero: Meet Gurpreet Singh, whose kind gesture saves the day!
In a heartwarming display of kindness, an Australian woman named Verrity Wandel shared a video on Instagram that has captured the Internet’s attention.
The clip features her postman, of Indian origin, going above and beyond his duty by saving her laundry from a sudden downpour.
Instead of just delivering her parcel and leaving, he decided to fold her clothes and move them indoors. He also left a thoughtful note explaining his actions.
Wandel later took to Instagram and posted a selfie with the postman and captioned the pic saying, “Meet Gurpreet Singh the amazing Postman that brought in the washing as it started to rain.”
View this post on Instagram
In her first post with the video she wrote, “We head in to check the surveillance system and this is what we find.
1 in a million this guy is so cool. Can't wait till my next delivery and I get to thank him 🙏.”
This incredible gesture has not only warmed hearts, but also caught the eye of actress Priyanka Chopra, sparking a wave of praise for the postman as a true ‘real-life hero’.
A user wrote, “What a gentleman. 🙌 Well done sir.”
Another said, “Such a legend,bless him!!❤️🌸,” while a third posted, “Sardar ji won everyone’s heart on social media, best example of Humanity ❤️.”
Another individual commented, “Not all heroes wear capes… some deliver mail! 👏 Surely he deserves more than just thanks. How about some recognition? @auspost.”

argos_summary: Gurpreet Singh, a postman in Logan, Australia, gained viral fame for his thoughtful act of saving a homeowner's laundry from rain by bringing it indoors instead of just delivering a package. Homeowner Verrity Wandel shared the heartwarming video on social media, leading to widespread praise for Singh, who is recognized for his kindness and service in line with his Sikh faith. The story has resonated with many, including actress Priyanka Chopra, highlighting the impact of small acts of kindness in the community.
